qas.question: What dam began to provide water to Hyderabad in 2005?
Along with dealing with sewerage and the water supply, what is one other thing the HMWSSB regulates?
How long is the pipeline from the Nagarjuna Sagar Dam which the HMWSSB operates?
Which company is responsible for electricity in Hyderabad?

answers.text: Telangana Southern Power Distribution Company Limited

qas.question: Which entity is responsible for the fire stations in Hyderabad?

answers.text: Telangana State Disaster and Fire Response Department

context: The HMWSSB regulates <a1_0>rainwater harvesting<a1_0/>, sewerage services and water supply, which is sourced from several dams located in the suburbs. In 2005, the HMWSSB started operating a <a2_0>116-kilometre-long (72 mi)<a2_0/> water supply pipeline from <a0_0>Nagarjuna Sagar Dam<a0_0/> to meet increasing demand. The <a3_0>Telangana Southern Power Distribution Company Limited<a3_0/> manages electricity supply. As of October 2014, there were 15 fire stations in the city, operated by the <a4_0>Telangana State Disaster and Fire Response Department<a4_0/>. The government-owned India Post has five head post offices and many sub-post offices in Hyderabad, which are complemented by private courier services.
